title: 111_hr5836
content: The "Border Security and Employee Verification Improvement Act of 2010" mandates an increase in Border Patrol agents by 2,000 each year from 2011 to 2013, with all agents deployed along the southern border. Additionally, the Act includes provisions for infrastructure improvements. SEC. 3. INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS. The Secretary of Homeland Security will construct or purchase office facilities, vehicles, fencing, and barriers to enhance border security. SEC. 4. TWO-LAYERED REINFORCED FENCING ALONG THE SOUTHERN BORDER OF THE UNITED STATES. The Secretary of Homeland Security will construct two layers of reinforced physical fencing along 150 miles of the southern border to deter unlawful border crossings. The Secretary of Homeland Security must ensure the completion of two-layered reinforced fencing and a Border Patrol access road within three years of the enactment of this subparagraph. If unable to complete, a report must be submitted. Homeland Security must complete two-layered reinforced fencing and a Border Patrol access road within three years. If unable to do so, a report must be submitted to Congress explaining the delay. Existing fencing cannot be used to meet the mileage requirement. The Secretary of Homeland Security must submit a report to Congress within 180 days of the Act's enactment, detailing a plan for constructing a physical fence along the entire southern border. The report should include the amount of fencing needed, a timeline for completion, prioritized high-traffic areas, and additional resources required from Congress for the construction. SEC. 5. STUDY ON E-VERIFY PROGRAM. The Secretary of Homeland Security must conduct a study on the E-Verify Program within 180 days of this Act. The study will analyze the participation of employers, both voluntary and required by law, and assess the feasibility of enhancing the program with additional information sources. The Secretary of Homeland Security will analyze various sources of information, such as databases used in I-9 audits, State-owned databases, and data on lost or stolen identities. Additionally, a determination will be made on the adequacy of legal protections for employers participating in the E-Verify program to shield them from liability for hiring unauthorized aliens.
